metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9454 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in i2c driver there is a possible out of bounds write due to memory corruption. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-150-generic - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-150.176

linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-150-generic - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-150-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176

notes.Note: sbeattie> same commit as CVE-2017-18551, possibly a dupe

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-150.176').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1084.94').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1047.53').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.118').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-150.176').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.119').
